intro: Eriosyce vallenarensis, commonly known as the Valparaíso moon cactus, is a species of cactus native to Chile. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense covering of white to pale blue spines. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, thriving in full sun and well-draining soil. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, blooming in late spring or early summer. Eriosyce vallenarensis is a popular ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
